channel.title: Hi Fellow RSPS Coders
channel.description: Hiya, i am kinda new to coding but i am catching on fairly fast. So, i was wondering if anyone know how i can share my RSPS to friends so they can play on it, or anyone. I heard about getting "no-ip" and Uturrent and ect.. "port forwarding" , but what do i do next? How can i share my RSPS with friends. Any way's i hope i get help that'll be great!!!. Bye ty =) Oh!, and let me know if you want to add my skype =)!.

item.title: Hi Fellow RSPS Coders
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Register a no-ip domain first would help, then have the DUC running, then put your no-ip that you registered into where ever the clients IP is set (Client.java or GUI.java), then release it to you friends. Try connecting yourself first to see if it works (via the no-ip, not localhost).

Plus there’s a sticky in Server Tutorials that explains it all.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi Fellow RSPS Coders
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“I love U I, post:6, topic:391997”]So i find a new client, or so i give them a copy of my client i am using?
Sorry if I’m being a NOOB I’m just having a hard time at the moment.
Because i don’t know i should give them the whole client file.[/quote]

Step 1: add the ip into the client
Step 2: make the entire client file a .rar
Step 3: upload to a site such as mediafire.
Step 4: Have the friend to download the client
Step 5: Friend unrars the file
Step 6: Friend presses run bam it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi Fellow RSPS Coders
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I love U I:

so, i let them download the client? then what? i tell them to put the no-ip thing in?

No you give them the new client they should be able to play auto from that.

Read full topic
